content.webTitle: Our pick of the week: The story, the stat, the quote, the tweet

fields.headline: Our pick of the week: The story, the stat, the quote, the tweet
fields.bodyText: The story Pie in your eye No other story caught the attention in quite the same way as Paul Daniels and his run-in with Sooty. The pint-sized magician got a black eye after he was hit by a flying pizza while filming a bit of slapstick fun for ITV's Sooty Show. Apparently, after the first take Daniels had complained that the pizza hadn't been thrown hard enough, but on the second he got more than he bargained for. He had to go to hospital and cancel a gig, but insisted producers use the take in which he was injured. The stat 57 ... … street sweepers have been crushed to death by drivers in Lagos, Nigeria, this year. But the man in charge of the deadly roads, state governor Babatunde Fashola, has started a scheme aimed at reforming the former capital's dangerous drivers. Now Lagosians who ignore the rules of the road face not just a £100 fine, but a psychiatric evaluation. The quote Ghada Ali "We want to see him humiliated like he humiliated us," said Ghada Ali, an Egyptian woman whose daughter was killed during the protests in Cairo earlier this year. "He" was former Egyptian leader Hosni Mubarak, in court this week accused of corruption and ordering the killing of protestors. The tweet @DuncanBannatyne Things got sinister on Twitter as the entrepreneur and no-nonsense Dragons' Den star Duncan Bannatyne took on a Russian blackmailer. Bannatyne initially offered £25,000 to anyone who could track down the tweeter who threatened to harm his daughter, with the reward going up to £50,000 if his arms were broken. Bannatyne later changed his offer to a more considered "£30,000 reward for info leading to his arrest".
